shiny.emojirain

Create stunning emoji shower animations for your R Shiny applications! ğŸ‰ Add festive, celebratory effects with customizable speed, rotation, and emojisâ€”perfect for holidays, celebrations, and special events.

Features

âœ¨ Zero Dependencies - Lightweight JavaScript, no external libraries needed
ğŸ¨ Highly Customizable - Control speed, rotation, particle count, and more
ğŸ­ Multiple Emoji Presets - Christmas, Halloween, Birthday, Spring, New Year, Love, Success, Party
ğŸ–¼ï¸ Image Support - Use emoji characters, web images, or local files
âš¡ Performance Optimized - Smooth animations with efficient DOM handling
ğŸ¯ Easy Integration - Simple API, works seamlessly with Shiny
ğŸ“± Responsive - Works on all screen sizes and devices

Installation

Install from GitHub:

# Install devtools if you haven't already
install.packages("devtools")

# Install shiny.emojirain
devtools::install_github("ineelhere/shiny.emojirain")

Quick Start

Basic Usage - Auto-trigger on Page Load 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  emoji_shower_ui(),
  h1("Welcome to the Celebration!")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {}

shinyApp(ui, server)

With Custom Emojis 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = c("ğŸ„", "ğŸ…", "â›„", "ğŸ", "â„ï¸"),
    trigger = "app_load",
    duration = 8000,
    fall_speed = 1.2,
    particle_count = 20
  ),
  h1("Christmas Celebration!")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Using Emoji Presets 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = emoji_presets()$halloween,
    duration = 6000,
    spin_speed = 2
  ),
  h1("ğŸƒ Happy Halloween! ğŸ‘»")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Manual Trigger with Server-side Control 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  setup_emoji_handler(),
  emoji_shower_ui(trigger = NULL),
  h2("Birthday Bash!"),
  actionButton("celebrate", "ğŸ‰ Click to Celebrate!", 
               class = "btn btn-success btn-lg")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  observeEvent(input$celebrate, {
    emit_shower(session)
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Advanced: Custom Parameters 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  setup_emoji_handler(),  # Required for manual triggering
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = emoji_presets()$party,
    trigger = NULL,
    duration = 10000,      # 10 second animation
    fall_speed = 2.0,      # Faster falling
    spin_speed = 3,        # Noticeable rotation
    particle_count = 25,   # More particles
    burst_count = 12,      # More bursts
    image_size = 48        # Larger emoji size
  ),
  h1("ğŸ¥³ New Year Party! ğŸ†"),
  actionButton("party", "Start the Party!", class = "btn btn-primary btn-lg"),
  br(), br(),
  p("Click the button to trigger the emoji shower!")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  observeEvent(input$party, {
    emit_shower(session)
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)

With Web Images 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = c(
      "https://via.placeholder.com/32/FFD700/FFD700?text=â˜…",
      "https://via.placeholder.com/32/FF69B4/FF69B4?text=â™¥"
    ),
    image_size = 32,
    trigger = "app_load"
  ),
  h1("Custom Image Shower!")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Multiple Showers with Different Triggers 

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  setup_emoji_handler(),
  h1("Multi-Shower Demo"),
  
  # First shower - auto-trigger
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = emoji_presets()$christmas,
    duration = 6000
  ),
  
  # Control buttons for manual showers
  br(),
  actionButton("xmas", "â„ï¸ Christmas", class = "btn btn-info"),
  actionButton("bday", "ğŸ‚ Birthday", class = "btn btn-warning"),
  actionButton("halloween", "ğŸ‘» Halloween", class = "btn btn-dark")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  observeEvent(input$xmas, {
    emit_shower(session)
  })
  
  observeEvent(input$bday, {
    emit_shower(session)
  })
  
  observeEvent(input$halloween, {
    emit_shower(session)
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Love/Valentine Theme

Create a romantic experience with a shower of hearts and roses:

library(shiny)
library(shiny.emojirain)

ui <- fluidPage(
  emoji_shower_ui(
    emojis = emoji_presets()$love,
    duration = 7000,
    fall_speed = 1.3,
    spin_speed = 2.5,
    trigger = "app_load"
  ),
  h1("ğŸ’• Spread the Love! ğŸ’•"),
  p("Perfect for Valentine's Day, anniversaries, or expressing appreciation!")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {}

shinyApp(ui, server)

Available Emoji Presets

Use the emoji_presets() function to access pre-made emoji collections:

# View all available presets
presets <- emoji_presets()
names(presets)

# Use a specific preset
emoji_presets()$christmas   # ğŸ„ ğŸ… â›„ ğŸ ğŸ”” âœ¨ â„ï¸ ğŸŠ
emoji_presets()$halloween   # ğŸƒ ğŸ‘» ğŸ¦‡ ğŸ•·ï¸ ğŸ’€ ğŸ§› ğŸ§™ ğŸ•¯ï¸
emoji_presets()$birthday    # ğŸ‚ ğŸˆ ğŸ‰ ğŸŠ ğŸ â­ ğŸŒŸ ğŸ€
emoji_presets()$spring      # ğŸŒ¸ ğŸ¦‹ ğŸŒ» ğŸŒº ğŸŒ· ğŸŒ¼ ğŸŒ¹ ğŸ
emoji_presets()$newyear     # ğŸ† ğŸ‡ âœ¨ ğŸ‰ ğŸ¥‚ â­ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŠ
emoji_presets()$love        # â¤ï¸ ğŸ’• ğŸ’– ğŸ’— ğŸŒ¹ ğŸ’ ğŸ’ ğŸ’
emoji_presets()$success     # ğŸ† ğŸ¥‡ ğŸ–ï¸ â­ ğŸŒŸ ğŸ’ ğŸ‘ ğŸ¯
emoji_presets()$party       # ğŸ‰ ğŸŠ ğŸˆ ğŸ ğŸ¥³ ğŸ¾ ğŸ† âœ¨

Function Reference

emoji_shower_ui()

Create the emoji shower animation UI component.

Parameters: - emojis - Character vector of emoji characters or image URLs (default: Christmas emojis) - trigger - When to trigger ("app_load" or NULL for manual) - duration - Animation duration in milliseconds (default: 6000) - fall_speed - Gravity factor, 0.5-2.5 (default: 1.5) - spin_speed - Rotation speed in degrees/frame (default: NULL) - particle_count - Number of particles per burst, 5-30 (default: 15) - burst_count - Number of bursts, 1-20 (default: 8) - image_size - Image size in pixels, 16-256 (default: 32)

emoji_presets()

Get a named list of pre-made emoji collections for common themes.

setup_emoji_handler()

Set up the Shiny message handler for manual shower triggering.

emit_shower(session)

Trigger an emoji shower from your server code. Requires setup_emoji_handler() in UI.

Testing

Run the test suite:

devtools::test()
